intro: Stenanthera pinifolia, commonly known as the needleleaf stenanthera, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Stenanthemaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or shrubland habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
